intro: Hieracium neosingulare, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. Hieracium neosingulare is often found in open habitats and can sometimes be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
